title: PDX; Waste Not, Want Not
name: PDX; Waste Not, Want Not
description:
A Map by Pdxnikkie

This map is an ever evolving guide to the free and salvagable sites located throughout inner portland, or. This includes; good dumpsters, fruit trees, local reusers, free corners, restaurants that dump food, free boxes, nut trees, community gardens, berrybushes, and other urban spaces that are concerned with reducing our communal consumption in the name of ecological sustainability...

properties.name: Alleged Fig Tree
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie   Aparently a tree at this site produced a plentiful amount of figs in the past. see for yourself.

properties.name: Alleged Pear Tree in Former Wild Oats Parking Lot
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie   A friend tells me there was a pear tree in the parking lot of the former wild oats. Image shoppers literally smashing fresh, ripe pears under their car tires on their way to BUY pears that have traveled more than the average american on their way to Wild Oats. Without the wild oats, however...who knows the fate of the pear tree. ride by and check it out.

properties.name: Apple Tree
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie   I hear from a friend that an apple tree grows on the NE corner of SE Salmon and 36th. See for yourself this late summer/fall. Maybe you could make a lovely apple tart and leave it on the doorstep of the home where the tree resides.

properties.name: Black Rose Collective
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie  The Black Rose is one of the last remaining novolties in the Mississippi District; where "revitalization" has turned the corner sharply toward "gentrification" and little remains save the Trendy3rd, post-work, cardigan crowd out for cocktails. But at the Black Rose Collective there is always free bread and baked goods in a box out front-as well as a pretty sweet free woredrobe closet. Take what you\'ll use, use what you take, give away what you don\'t.

properties.name: Faerie Teahouse at Full Circle Temple
properties.description: Posted by Daus 3125 E Burnside St, Portland, OR, 97214Cob teahouse/outdoor sanctuary.

properties.name: Free Day Old Bagles
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie  3535 SE Hawthorne, Portland OrNoah has been known to set out day old bagles for us scavengers.

properties.name: Free Mississippi Pizza!!
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie  Firstly, they make incredible pizza, are a local business and have live music every night. I strongly suggest supporting their legitimate business venture. However, if you happen to be hungry at closing time (between 11-11:30) you could be in luck for a slice. They\'ll set the left overs on the benches out front-or simply walk in and ask for it.

properties.name: Hot Corner; NE 24th and Glisan
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie Corner of NE 24th and Glisan, Portland, OR 97232This Corner is often a drop spot for random free items. Previously, I was living with friends near here and our house soon became full of furniture, books, cloths, shoes, apliances etc from this corner. We returned a fair amount of junk to the place in the end. The surrounding area is also randomly "littered" with free stuff.

properties.name: Native Trees & Fruit Guild
properties.description: Posted by Outerference SE 90th & E Burnside, PortlandPermaculture site in meidan between 90th & 92nd on E. Burnside

properties.name: New Seasons Free Bread/Dumpsters
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie  New Seasons puts out old bread in a cart behind the store, I\'m sure their dumpters are also worth checking out

properties.name: P.Crest
properties.description: Posted by Llantipode  4 small blueberry bushes, lots of sage and mint, Gordon the community mailbox, occasional book exchange. aspiring intersection repair.

properties.name: Pear Tree out in front of Low Brow
properties.description: Posted by Tracy_the_astonishing  1036 NW Hoyt St, Portland, ORFull of fruit. Not quite ripe yet, but check back mid-August. Don\'t let these pears go to waste!

properties.name: SCRAP
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie3901A N Williams St, Portland, ORGo to SCRAP for gift making, halloween, babysitting field trips, classroom exercises, service learning adventures, dates, and random odds and ends searching. Doesn\'t everybody need a little more memory foam or bicycle innertubes?

properties.name: Share-It Square Free Community Space
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie Share-it Square is the epitome of shared community space and goods. Here you will find a free box, a kids play/club house, and a tea station; where free tea can be consumed any day of the week! Ride by, bring something to share, rejuvinate your spirits in this landmark intersection.

properties.name: The Rebuilding Center
properties.description: Posted by PdxnikkieThis is an amazing community resource for salvaged building materials. Someone else did the salvaging this time, but supporting their hard work is keeping it local (N/NE pdx) and diverting materials from the waste stream. reduce, REUSE, recycle

properties.name: Ungodly amounts of blackberries in august
properties.description: Posted by Jason  This neighborhood "sullivan\'s gulch" has a blackberry festival each year in august, and i swear it\'s go to have it\'s roots in this very patch.

properties.name: Walnut (English)
properties.description: Posted by Arifilahi  5606 NE 16th Ave Portland Oregonharvest in the fall

properties.name: Wild Oats Dumpsters
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie 2825 E Burnside St, Portland, ORThese dumpsters are caged in behind the store but usually unlocked. Bring a flashligh and appropriate shoes!

properties.name: Wild Oats Dumpsters (2)
properties.description: Posted by Pdxnikkie  You thought these were locked, huh...dumpsters are accessible through the back of the laundry mat. Just walk through like you own the place.

properties.name: belmont free box
properties.description: Posted by Paiges freespotfree box for everything. people put out record players (where i got mine), furniture, couches, clothes, shoes, music, books and food. right hand side of the dumpster facing west.

properties.name: cherry tree
properties.description: Posted by Jason  ne davis and 20th, portland, ornot a lot of fruit withing reach, but a very fruitful tree.

properties.name: citybikes free box
properties.description: Posted by Paiges 1914 se ankeny portland oregonfree box for bike parts, bikes, tires and such

properties.name: twin pear trees hanging over sidewalk
properties.description: Posted by Jason   se 58th just south of division st, portland, orlook like they\'ll be ripe early to mid august, or later. the house has plenty of fruit, so it\'s unknown their real willingness to share, but many many of there are hanging over the sidewalk, and are technicaly fair game.
